title: Lengthy Process for Operating Licenses
description: In 2017, it took 176 days to obtain an operating license in Uruguay, indicating a lengthy bureaucratic process compared to global standards.

title: Minimal Impact of Health Expenditure on Poverty
description: In 2016, only 0.01% of Uruguay's population was pushed below the $2.15 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, showcasing effective financial protection in health care.

title: Negligible External Health Expenditure
description: In 2021, external health expenditure accounted for a mere 0.00015186% of Uruguay's current health expenditure, highlighting the country's self-reliance in health funding.

title: Low External Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: Uruguay's external health expenditure per capita was just $0.0024 in 2021, reflecting minimal reliance on foreign health funding.

title: Minimal External Health Expenditure Per Capita (PPP)
description: In 2021, Uruguay's external health expenditure per capita, adjusted for purchasing power parity, was only $0.0035, underscoring its financial independence in health care.
